snippet: Victims of the attack were said to include members of a Taliban-allied faction that held Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl in captivity.
abstract: Pakistani officials say Central Intelligence Agency has ended its five-month hiatus from drone campaign in country, resuming with missile strike that killed at least four people at compound in tribal district of North Waziristan.

byline.original: By ISMAIL KHAN and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Ismail Khan reported from Peshawar, and Declan Walsh from London. Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud contributed reporting from Islamabad, Pakistan, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Victims of the attack were said to include members of a Taliban-allied faction that held Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl in captivity.

headline.main: Missile Strike by C.I.A. Drone Kills at Least 4, Pakistan Reports
headline.print_headline: Missile Strike by C.I.A. Drone Kills at Least 4, Pakistan Reports

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
